pros: Flexible time shifts Great members of staff always eager to assist Decent salary
cons: None for now. Will update if any.

review_title: Good job for students, could be better though
pros: Flexible work Customer service Some retail/sales if you are allocated as an Arena Receptionist
cons: Zero hours contracts May sometimes work really long hours

pros: Canteen hashbrowns are pretty decent?
cons:
1. Nepotistic hiring practices. 
2. Unclear, inconsistent promotion practices.
3. Salaries much lower than that of similar insititutions, but high work loads.
4. Total lack of appraisals and unclear progression routes. 
5. Disparity between salaries at top and bottom ends.
6. High staff turnover. Hire low-paid graduates from UoW.
7. Personality appears to trump skill. Toxic environment.
8. Upper management that is entirely nontransparent.
9. Rather than an emplyee in a well-oiled machine, I felt more like a rung on somebody else's career ladder.
12. Skilled staff are made to work Open Days and Welcome Weekends.

pros:
- Some colleagues genuinely care and are lovely to work with. 
- Worcester is a pretty city.
cons:
- Toxic management who have actively driven off entire teams worth of people.
- A Vice Chancellor who makes life even harder for his staff by not signing off on necessary positions. 
- Nothing ever gets done, though there's plenty of talk and 'good intentions'.
- Attrocious pay compared to the same job in other Uni's in the area. 
- The lack of staff means employees are having two or three people's workloads dumped on them without any compensation. 
- Very cliquey.
- No real progression opportunities.

pros: Good support from managing staff
cons: Salary is lower than similar jobs at other locations

job_title: Green Impact Assistant in Worcester, England
pros: Flexible, Good environment, Insightful, easy
cons: nothing really, it was good

pros: New skills and experiences acquired
cons: Cannot find any Cons from working at the University of Worcester

review_title: If you're a student, give it a try
pros: Very fun, get to interact with a lot of people
cons: Hard to get 20h a week to make a part-time job

review_title: support work in higher education setting
job_title: Student Support Worker in Worcester, England
pros: Interesting sitting in lectures, and most of the students appreciate the support we provide to help them with practical issues like note-taking and sighted guiding to enable them to participate in University education.
cons: the pay is low considering that when I joined 7 years ago they required workers to have a degree. The hours can be erratic depending on the needs of the indivdual students, The number of hours each week and the costs of on-site parking or travel to and from work do not make it a well-paying job.

pros:
Career development
Salary
Annual leave and study leave
cons:
Long hours
Unnecessary meetings.
Hard to work from home

pros:
Lovely campus
Lovely colleagues
Good leadership
High standards
cons: Terribly slow HR recruitment system

pros: Brilliant experiences of working with students and gaining further employment in various roles across the university to develop CV. Good level of training provided. Life long friendships made.
cons: After such an amazing start to my working life at the university over 3 years ago, I was so saddened to find my working life deteriorate so rapidly at the university! If you are looking for a role in events or sport facilities, I advise against this strongly. A toxic environment ensues with big brother style management (namely at the university arena), poor handling of COVID risk assessing, racism and constant blame shifting. AVOID APPLYING FOR ROLES IN SPORT/EVENTS: IT’S NOT WORTH THE MENTAL HEALTH DEGRADATION!

pros:
Good rate of pay
Perfect for students
Plenty of support
cons: None that I can think of

review_title: Bad pay and too much work
pros: Good supporting team. Access to their resources.
cons: Bad pay since you have to work too many hours preparing materials and supporting the students. They pay per hour is just for the lectures. They do not pay for revising papers or meetings.

pros: A very friendly environment and nice colleagues.
cons: Would benefit from modern systems.

review_title: Enjoyed my time but wouldn’t return
pros: Great colleagues , local , nice campus , good facilities
cons: no progression for non academic staff, additional benefits don’t compensate for low salaries ( ie no flexi , minimum holiday allowance )

review_title: A great place to work and grow
pros: Team, vision, and location, a real community feeling
cons: not as hight on the ref and grants as other universities, focus on quality teaching

pros: Great staff & management. Take into consideration your preferred shifts to work especially if you are currently a student.
cons: Sometimes it can be quite quiet, so as long as you can keep yourself busy!

review_title: Good but not great due to covid

pros: Flexible job, you decide whether you want to take up offered jobs such as open day events

pros: Getting to meet new Students ,that have the Courage to walk through that door to Studie and Box for this University, Proud of every one of them,

pros: access to work support and equipment for disabled staff, good facilities for disabled staff and students
cons: irritating expenses systems and assumption everyone has and/ or is comfortable using smartphones and tablets to navigate them, when such kit and training isn't routinely given to staff, including those on low wages/zero hours contracts.

pros: Many of the departments are very friendly and helpful to each other meaning cross department communication is quick and efficient
cons: The international management team do not listen to ideas for change or improvement of the service leading to disengagement of the student staff

pros: Lovely people, great atmosphere and a real pleasure in working here. Salary isn't bad either.
cons: Admin is pretty slow, tax and pay problems always take at least a few weeks to resolve.

pros:
Fantastic institution to work for.
Caring.
Flexible working + benefits
Positive environment; forward thinking
Excellent progression options.
Respect for health and well being.
cons: I really cannot say there are any cons.

review_title: Nice place to work, good salary
pros: The campus is wonderful, lots of food too. Good team with a lot of communication and training.
cons: It's a student job, once it's over it's over.

pros: Incredibly respectful; genuinely care for their employees well-being.
